byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Rome, and Laurie Goodstein from New York.
byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and LAURIE GOODSTEIN

abstract: Pope Francis, during assembly of women's religious orders, comments on idea of ordaining women as deacons; Index Note: first half of this story was omitted in print version due to production error but full article is available online.
lead_paragraph: His comments, revealing an openness to re-examine the church’s insistence on an all-male clergy, were hailed as a breakthrough by women who have clamored for more of a role.

headline.main: Pope Francis Says Panel Will Study Whether Women May Serve as Deacons
headline.print_headline: Francis Says Panel Will Study if Women Can Be Deacons

snippet: His comments, revealing an openness to re-examine the church’s insistence on an all-male clergy, were hailed as a breakthrough by women who have clamored for more of a role.

keywords.value: United States Conference of Catholic Bishops
keywords.name: organizations
